one_reviews_text: I haven't enjoyed a mech game this much since Mech warrior 2.  It has lot of surprising options an settings that are PC friendly.  Please improve the resolution of the environment outside the Competence's window and maybe animate it a bit.

review_title: A brilliant Mech Game for VR
one_reviews_text:
Pros: 
Customizable loadouts for each mech to fit your playstyle
Physics
Engaging combat
Beautiful graphics
Fluid controls
Sound and Music 



Cons: 
Multiplayer game with very small community (this will change with the campaign+quest 2 release!)
Lack of incentive to keep coming back aside from having fun (let's face it, we like chasing after something, whether it be for unlocks, titles, cosmetics, or any sort of achievement to reach).  

Final thoughts: The fun factor is already there, its a very fun game, its just lacking a player base and a reason for players to keep coming back. However, with the campaign and quest 2 release coming, I'm hoping this game gets the recognition it deserves and we get to see this game turn into a true popular live service VR game! Looking forward to March 3rd!

review_title: Some of the most fun I have ever had!
one_reviews_text:
I will not be able to describe how good this game is, it is truly a masterpeice in terms of fun! 

I heard about this game about 2 weeks ago and waited to research it. All of a sudden its getting a quest port and its cross buy so I imeddietly open up my oculus app, buy it, and start up Revive and... HOLY COW ITS GOOD.

This game ticks all the boxes for a great game its got fun and uniqe gameplay, awsome visuals, a soon to be added campign mode with a full story, cinimatic combat, weighty and good controls, and immersive nature! It amazing and I really appriciate what the devs did here.

I can really only judge multiplayer rn as the campign drops on March 3rd

But I will say the multiplayer is... AMAZING!!!!!!! I cant say much but ist just so much fun and the lobby  I got in was full of kind and welcoming people who were happy to talk and teach me some basics!

Either way BUY IT NOW!!!

review_title: Best VR mech game by far
one_reviews_text:
This game is amazing. I have been playing it for over two years and have seen the game get updated frequently. Really excited for the new campaign/story mode as well as it working on the quest.  

Highly recommended. One is the best vr games I have experienced and the community is friendly and helpful.

review_title: One of the BEST games I have ever played
one_reviews_text: After a good 2-4 hours, I have experienced a ton of fun! I love this game dearly and recommend it.

I'm having a lot of fun with this one.  The controls were a little difficult initially but once you get used to them you understand the beauty of the physics.  You pilot a large battle mech where you really get a sense for the large mass of it.  There seems to be a good amount of strategy involved as well.  Highly recommend.

review_title: Best use of VR to date, needs content.
one_reviews_text:
I have played many VR titles since I purchased my CV1 and this is by far one of my favorites. The controls feel natural and are intuitive, and the immersion is through the roof. 

Further thoughts: 
1. The customization is bare-bones, but effective at allowing for different playstyles. 
2. The playerbase is great, but small.
3. PvP is fun and engaging, but I would be interested in seeing some sort of campaign.
4. Super immersive.
5. Great sense of scale.
6. Has a great aesthetic that makes it feel more grounded.

All in all, I believe this game has amazing potential and would highly recomend this to any person who's ever imagined piloting a giant robot. Would give a 4.5 if the site allowed.

Low Player Base, The game is amazing and i hjave a blast playing it, even without players, and when there are guys online the whole community seems pretty possitive. The game is amazing and if you are thinking about buying it then you should.

The game is fun and immersive. I would ask the developer to allow the player to limit the up-and-down motion being displayed while the mech is walking, to minimize motion sickness (unless there is one already and I haved missed the setting control). In addition, please add single player campaign -- I am old school mech gamer and am not into PvP especially when it is the only option. Thank you.
I waited to get this and it was on sale so I gave it a shot. Once you get used to the controls, it's VR fun at it's best.
I hope VM will get a proper single player campaign one day. I love the PvP mode but this game could be more than that.

Giving you the experience that you want, you are driving a mech. You are taking said mech using joysticks in a Virtual Enviroment that feel like you're riding the Willy Wonka bubble machine. Or if you've ever driven a bobcat, it feels like that. Push this, turn this. Pull on the good ol train handle hanging on the upper right for a honk. Grab a radio to communicate with your team.  Well, I am giving it three stars because they did a good job at coding how to drive the mech. I can be aiming (with the headset center being the aim) and grab a joysticks in the enviroment seemlessly. I always look because I'm just used to other experiences where you actually look at the thing you're supposed to be "grabbing" and find you're not actually grabbing what you think you would (Like a gun in a holster.) I'm impressed that I can grab the joysticks without looking at them. However I don't care for blowing up people in multiplayer over and over. I need a story or a way to advance, collect money and make my mech more powerful. THAT would be my idea of a better mech game.

review_title: One of the Best Games for VR.
one_reviews_text:
One of the Best Games for VR.
Please add a single-player campaign.
this pvp is good

review_title: THE worth successor to MW games
one_reviews_text:
With almost 370 hours in, this game has me coming back for more.  The weapons are varied, well-balanced, and each require a certain amount of practice to master, and so are the GDR/Grinders, which can equip varying amounts and types of weapons.

VR tracking with the Oculus Rift HMD is spot on, and the controls make you feel like you're something between a pilot and a truck driver.  Some GDRs respond quickly to movement controls, but lack firepower and armor, and you will definitely feel the weight of the heavier ones, although heavily armored, you will struggle to maneuver them around the map, as expected.  All limbs are removable, but don't let a lost arm or leg let you down.  Lost limbs, in addition to lost armor plates, give the pilot advantage of reduced weight, which equates to MORE maneuverability.  Soar to new heights with your crippled GDR! :D

The weapons at your disposal aren't far off from MW games I grew up with.  They come in different classes, from small mounts, to extra large mounts.  Some GDRs can hold certain types, and weapons vary from explosive cannons and missles, to lasers, rail guns, and the Vox equivalent of a shotgun.  Ammo is no concern, but heat is.  Heat management can mean the difference between getting out of the fight alive, or shutting down and being a sitting duck to your enemies, long enough to cool down or get blown up.  And if you find yourself high on heat, your GDR is a weapon itself, too!  Throw your GDR at an enemy.  Collision-based damage is a popular way to take enemies out while keeping your weapons cool and ready for the next volley.

The physics is very convincing, and the sound was recently upgraded to feature spacialization.  Music and special effects are very good.

The community has been wonderful, and the devs are active and open to suggestions in their Discord server.  It's unfortunate that many negative reviews were left, despite the game showing much promise and potential.

You can drive a mech, and not only that you feel as if I'm driving a mech.  Controls, graphics etc: all seem to work fine.
I feel as if i'm playing a finished game even though it's in EA.  One of the better mech games.
So why only 3 stars? 
 It's multiplayer only, and with there already being a glut of multiplayer mech games it's nothing special.  It urgently need single player content if it's want's to succeed.  Include single player content then it's a instant buy.

review_title: A real mech game for VR
one_reviews_text:
Sit in the cockpit of an oversized mech and interact with the controls around you using Touch motion controllers in probably THE best cockpit game for VR right now.

Word of note: It is a MP only game, that has full matches during peak hours for major regions. There is offline bot modes, and if you start an online server with bots to shoot, often people will join you.
This is exactly what I dreamed of when I hoped Mecha and VR aligned. Looking forward to what this game brings in the future. It's already the best Mecha experience on VR. Just buy it.

I dunno how it took me so long to look at this game. Its straight up awesome, epecially to a MechWarrior geek like myself. The game looks real good. Everything works  yeah singleplayer would be cool, but whatever I just drove a Mech! Yeah get in here and play!

Game is very difficult to organize and play. It is extremely frustrating the game stops almost every 2 minutes to repair the robot and continue. The game does not instruct you in an intelligent way to understand the action needed to move on. The slow action is so much in disarray that I always get dizzy and get a headache. The graphics ARE HORRIBLE AND THE ROBOTS ARE DIFFICULT TO MOVE ABOUT. WHAT A TRAGIC WASTE OF MY MONEY!
Some reviews say the controls are hard, and they're not wrong. BUT. The game is fun and if you go into it wanting to have fun and goof around for an hour, it is perfect.

Mechwarrior. All the past mech games I have played. Everything was leading to this game! I feel it is so well done! Being in the cockpit of a HUGE battle mech is amazing. They give you just enough gadgets and doohickeys to grab and swivel, Hell there is even a horn! Yes its as loud as you would imagine! And Dont be worried if you think it will be to hard! Its so simply done yet they make you feel in control so well. I mean it its easier then driving a car! Haha. The battles are intense, you can do offline bot battles and customize a lot! For example you can make 3 teams where its 5v5v6 because 16 mechs is the max but still thats more then I thought they would do! You can choose a mech from about 7 diff bodies, and then go further and choose weapons and such. Id suggest getting this game, especially if its on sale! 15$ is a steal for this great amazing mech pilot sim game. Just get it and go crazy! 5 out of 5 EASY

review_title: Game is broken for me - Before I refund
one_reviews_text: When launching the game it is in 2 windows thru my VR headset. That 1st bullet logo is crosseyed. Stupidly pusing crosseyed buttons i make it to taining and LOL, the game is messed up. Every thing is doubled eyed. The game is brokem for my rig or its just broken simple, I have over 100 VR games + so its not my rig. AMD Ryzen. Help please or refund in next 24 hours = email me as I will be at work. Yes Essential worker.. Just wanna play a cool looking game but this is like watching a stereo movie with no 3d red and green glasses.....
review_feedback: Hello, sorry we didn't see this earlier. This seems to be a problem with some AMD GPU driver versions, and should be fixed by updating your AMD drivers to the latest version. You can email us at contact@space-bullet.com (we don't have any way to get your email info), and we can help get you sorted out even if you already refunded it.

one_reviews_text:
MechWarrior was my favorite game back in the day. In the present age, with a decent graphics card and VR headset (I'm using Oculus Quest with official Link cable) - we get a really satisfying, balanced and fun experience.

Single player is playable for hours on end.
Multi-player is lacking players - (currently in Alpha) - buy this game - get early access and let's battle!

Quadro P5000, Xeon W2125
Have spent a lot of hours in this game just having fun!

So this is true and true a mech (er...grinder) game.  The grinders have a slow plodding motion that feels like you're moving a large robot of destruction acrosss the map.  When they collide (both physically and when they shoot) they FEEL like they're giant warbots tearing into each other with no finesse and only one purpose...to rip each other appart.

There's a TON of opportunity here too as it's early access and they'll be adding/improving.  Of course it's easy for me to suggest...e.g. don't let pilots auto-eject so if they die in the cockpit you get a bonus score and they take longer to respawn, etc. but I'm not the dev's (or a programer) so I'll just rely on their good judgement...which has been pretty outstanding so far.
I loved the original low poly first person MechWarrior for DOS VGA back in the day. This is that... in VR. And it's awesome. Perfectly recaptures the joy right down to the overheating.

Runs smooth on my potato gtx 1060 3gb while still looking great.  Just the right speed to be fun without making you sick.  Game even has support for hotas!  Touch controls work well also.  Just a well made game all around and devs seem keen to support it long term.
Bravo to the Devs for making this game. Look forward  Up Comming Changes and patches.

I'm not sure if I was fooled by other 5 star reviews or by the trailer or maybe because I remember Mech Warrior from back in the day. I find this game incredibly simplistic, slow and monotonous. The whole heat-management scheme is terribly conceived. Noone wants to have their mech clam-up in the middle of battle for 30 seconds to cool down after firing off a few rounds. There are other ways of limiting ammo-usage besides simply halting gameplay. The physics are set to such a slow pace that gameplay feels like walking in sand. I have other issues but those are the two deal-breakers for me. I woudn't recommend this game to anyone.

There is so much unused potential at the moment. I was very disappointed that you have so few controls in the cockpit that you can and must use. But thats exactly the point where VR can show its strength. I want to use the knobs, levers and displays in the cockpit. Whats about an emergency cooling system? An extinguishing system? A switchable optics system? At the moment the gameplay has not enough depth for me and the advantages of VR are not used enough. But that doesnt mean it cant be done. So I hope the game will continue growing and bring in those features to make it more complex in future.

I played this game every night untill my PC was bricked by an assumed hacker.
I have spent over a thousand dollars repairing my PC and upgrading to the Rift S
just to play this game again. The title of this review comes from what all the new players always say once the get a feel for the controlling their grinder(mech).

Giant Robots, Explosions, Lasers, Giant cannons, Joystick support, Multiplayer with or without bots, Quite a bit of replay with all the weapon, and loadout Nuances, Good balancing for a pvp game, Active Developer who listens to the community through his discord. If you're fan of Mecha, I'd suggest giving this game a try, Worth every penny!
90s pc gamers will get it.

I have to say, I was intrigued at first, but the fact that you have so much control only while sitting and with the way visual feedback is delivered it actually feels like you are controlling a mech.
Customization options are okay, you can outfit your style of mech with a couple or a few different weapons you can choose from.
Gameplay modes in terms of variety are pretty good, I love the salvage mode.
My only problem with this game is that it doesn't have enough people playing it so finding a game with people will be hard, however, that being said, you can always create a lobby yourself with your own prefered rules and add bots. The AI is not "that bad"  but its good based on the experience it offers.
5/5 loved it
Tend to play about an hour a day on this bad boy, great community, fun game happy days!

review_title: This is why I got an oculus. Very Fun.
one_reviews_text: This is a great game for the oculus and really is quite imersive. Very good for the mech fans but also very fun for everyone else.
Need to do something to get more players online though. as it stand i couldbt find anyone to play with

review_title: For the Mech Fans....and anyone else
one_reviews_text:
You like mechs? Buy this game
You ever thought maybe you could like mechs? Buy this game
You like fun? Buy this game
You breath air? Buy this game
Only Problem.... In the Training session.... Needs to show how to Epuip the Mech to learn what each weapon is etc...

review_title: Finally! A Great Mech VR Game
one_reviews_text:
I have wanted a mech simulator game ever since I first donned the HMD. I didn't even realize this one existed until randomly finding while searching the Oculus store for something new to try. 

This game has a large number of chassis to choose from and nearly unlimited ways to equip them. Want to customize your own personal fast-moving, jump jetting sniper mech? You can do that. Wanna build a heavily armed behemoth with missle racks and cannons for front line combat? You can do that too. Just remember to balance for heat. Nothings worse than waiting for your systems to cool off while you get hammered by enemy pilots.

The in-cockpit controls are amazing and very easy to use once you get used to them. You nearly forget you are NOT sitting in a giant mech . It is the most immersive mech experiance I've ever had. Simply awesome. 

It is almost perfect. All I could ask for is perhaps a few auxiliary equipment slots to add a little more depth to mech load-outs. Some countermeasures, perhaps? Smoke screens? Shields? Repair kits? And a single player story driven campaign would have been nice, but we are talking about a game that costs $25 at full price. I understand the developers had a budget and a limited niche market to sell to. 

I still cannot believe I had never even heard of a game this awesome. Here's hoping they find a way to optimize it enough to sell on less powerful, more market share HMDs like the Quest and PSVR. This game deserves to be seen be as many gamers as possible. We need a sequel! Great job, Space Bullet.

review_title: This is an Oculus Rift Seller bar none!
one_reviews_text: This is my 1st review in Oculus. I come from the world of Hawken and Steel Battallion. If you are looking for an incredible mech game and experience of presence, this game dose not disappoint. The experience is very unique. On the fence? Just buy it. Demonstrates why we bought VR. Unbelievable Game!!!!
Super fun and satisfying!
butt no one plays it

Excellent controls. Feels like you are driving a mech, very sim like. Easily the best mech game on VR right now. Runs great, and looks great. The cockpit of the mech is very detailed, and useful! So much potential too, a campaign would be awesome! If more games were this polished, VR would be in a completely different situation. Just buy it, even if you're not a mech game fan you'll enjoy this.

review_title: One of the best titles I’ve played yet!!
one_reviews_text: I was surprised at how much fun i am having with this game. The touch controls are really good and the gameplay is so much fun. I wish that there was also a campaign to play thru as well but I do love playing against the bots to get used to playing each of the mechs. This is one of the best games I’ve played for the Rift and finally fulfilling the fantasy of being a mech pilot 😁😁😁

Had this game for several months now, and it's my constant 'go-to' ... You can play as quick as a 15 minute round, or marathon play... Was a big MechWarrior PC fan back in the day, and this brings that experience into near-full reality... Just excellent!  Game seems to have continued updates and improvements as time goes on, never had an issue with performance... ever.  Solid, get it, come play with us!

...but this game needs to go beyond the team vs team cheap layout. The game is good, it's the best Mech game out there and my only favourite Mech game was the old good Mechwarrior 3, and why? Because It was a kind of sim for the time it was released, with awesome huge missions and lots of Mechs and armaments, and also meaningfull management of your mech stats. Vox Machinae is heavily inspired by Battletech and it's a good thing actually, but It lacks the depths in terms of gameplay that confine it into a "meh" status. Game is fun in PvP / PvE for a very short while, then you realize The game lacks...well the game. It would be a pity to keep this absolute gem in this state. Vr or not Vr it's the only game in 20 years that lets you be inside a cockpit of a huge walker and actually use it the way it's supposed to (or at least it tries to give you that immersion). Very good idea, content absent. 3 Stars for now, let's see how it develops. I wouldn't call it a sim, because it's light years away from a sim, yet.

review_title: And I´m not even a mech fan...
one_reviews_text:
But this game is really great. Visuals are top-notch, even though I had to tweak the default settings a bit. I love the incredible detail on the ground, that really help making the environment feel organic and natural. 
I love the attention to detail. That you can reach up and pull that trucker style horn and move around stuff in the cockpit. That you can reach forward and turn that ignition key. I also absolutely love how you have to grab the mic and hold it to your mouth when you speak with your teammates. Im a great fan of immersive mechanics like that, and hope they add more - Headlights for really dark cave systems and wires with grappling hooks to trap a fleeing Hopper etc. As long as you have to reach somewhere and flip a switch, or toggle a button im happy.

Effects are just right. Smoke, debris, and parts falling off after those cannon shells hit the target. Dustclouds, lightning and other environmental effects help making the maps get their own very distinctive feel, and the battles feel chaotic. 

I look forward to more grinding noises and vibrations when you crash into other mechs. Wrestling with another machine of that size should cause a bit more chaos to really stress you. Same goes for really critical hits.  I would suggest sparks inside the cockpit. Alarms going off (that you can mute with a switch of course), and random stuff falling around you (like pieces of the interior falling behind causing a racket). Maybe grab that fire extinguisher to your right to take out a fire in the cockpit?
Physics is actually a thing as well, and it quite possible to use your mass to push other mechs in close combat, which is nice. This is probably something that can be explored further, with classes even more equipped for tanking and blocking enemy assaults.

This game got so much potential. With a few more "classes", maybe a few support mechs being able to repair other mechs, and another one for defending and shielding I can see this being a great competetive game.

First Review and I dont normally review but this game deserves it. 
Amazing gameplay, it really feels like you are the pilot of your Mech (Grinder). Controls are easy once you go through the tutorial. Only thing it needs is more players. So buy this game and join a match, you wont be disappointed.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G !

CONs: 
-If you dont like big giant "slow" battle mechs to fight exclusively in multiplayer... I would say you probably wont like it.
-The bots. not very smart to say the least. They get in the way, they lack of tactics, get stuck, they crash on your mech and they are an easy prey during multiplayer combats. They are not a buggy hell, they are just "meh"...
-Not a lot of players around :,(
-Needs more stuff: Maps, weapons, gameplay mechanics, modes, etc. IT NEEDS MORE PEPPER XD!

PROs:
-few players+bots surprisingly makes it more tactical sometimes, as you need to cooperate and move with your team and "use" bots to your advantage while destroying those from the other team/s. (you can play solo/no-bots etc. but it feels meh... and your team needs you!) 
-You love Mechs? "slow"-but-"faster-if-you-get-to-drive-them-well" heavy semi-steampunk ones to operate manually through gritty handles?
(not those shinny kanji evangelion ones in wich the robots just replicate your moves...Im joking I like those too XD, dont get me wrong...)

Think more of a future giant mad max robot that feels like operating an old truck/train made for near apocalipse war XD)...

You like Battletech? Mechwarrior? oh boy you are gonna love this....

-if you want to try a VR game where you can play seated,no need for room scale, in a Big war machine with full cockpit control (you are the pilot, not the robot!) with a fun voice com system for crazy team vs. team gameplay, blasting big robots, evading incoming fire, planning through giant jumps where to take cover and quickly decide who to shoot before a bullet-hell ravages you, drowning in excesive heat as much as it can handle before locking your controls for cooldown (careful with this, you become an easy target XD hide and/or turn off the engine for  a few seconds) loosing limbs, refusing to eject untill you can destroy as much as posible, then eject before getting blasted & back into field to make your team win...

EPIC

When I was about 8 years old, I got my first introduction to the benefits of PC gaming in the form of Mech Warrior 2 on windows 95. Compared to everything I had experienced on the genesis or the snes, Mech Warrior 2 felt so profoundly next level and I've been a proud member of the PC master Race ever since. About 20 years later, I'm happy to say that Vox Machinae gives me that same feeling of awe that I experienced as a child. 

This feels like next level gaming. As much as I enjoyed Archangel, I now feel that this is the definitive Mech combat game for VR. The balance of the mechs and the customizable loadouts are all very well done. It takes a bit of getting used to but the motion controlls are a joy to use. Some may prefer to play with a game pad to increase their response time but while I appreciate that this is an option, using the touch controllers is so much more fun. Theres nothing more satisfying than oblitering an enemy grinder with a well placed rocket barrage, then taunting them by blowing your horn trucker style. (you actually have to reach up and pull a cord hanging above you). 

On the other hand the game could benefit from more customization options as well as unique cockpits for all the different mech types. Since the game is still early access, I wouldnt be surprised if the devs add this down the road. That being said, this is now one of the games that I use to show off the Rift to friends and family and it's a must buy if you enjoy mech sims.

I was like you (probably), reading trhough the reviews and thinking that this game was maybe okay, but not AS good as people are claiming it to be.

Oh BOI was I wrong!

STYLE
The steampunk style of the game is the first thing I really noticed and how different from the Hawken, Merch Warriors and other Merch games of our epoch. Not everyone is fan of  the steampunk style, but this should not stop you from trying this one. It brings a unique vibe and most importantly it reflects in the way you control your Mech. 

CONTROL
This is where the game shines the most IMO.

The controls look and feel "analog" in the sense that you almost feel like driving a car. Push that lever, pull on that button, pull the horn handle :)

Pretty soon after the tutorial and after a few online games, you will realize just how INTUITIVE the controls are. Your hands will find the controls by themselves and rare are the moments where the controls feel awkward with the touch controllers.

This is the first time I am so immersed in a VR game because the controls feel right.

GAMEPLAY
I recommend to develop your piloting skills a little bit on a server with bots. However don't linger there too long, as you will truly witness the tactical aspect of the game on a populated server. Each Mech class has a unique playstyle.

CONCLUSION
This game took me by surprise. I bought it driven by pure boredome and discovered a VR game I really intend to play often (Pretty rare I can tell you).

You must know however that the play population is a bit low, like most of the multiplayer VR games, but so far the people I played with were pretty awesome.

I could continue like that for a while, but let's keep this one "short". If you were "thinking" about bying this one but not sure, give it a try.

Also, I started my little dedicated server ROBOJOX-US-EAST if you're trying to find a server to start.

Cheers!
It is kind of hard to navigate caves.  And there doesn't seem to be alot to do with not many players.

This is exactly as I have imagined piloting a mech would be... industrial feel, responsive turning and movement like driving a big truck 😁 And guns! And rockets! And more Mechs!
Is a single player campaign on the way??? Please say there is... (praying)

review_title: One of the better uses of VR I've seen
one_reviews_text: While still in EA, it has some fantastic mechanics, with almost everything in the cockpit having a use and being interactable. Combat is slower and more tactical that some might think going in, but that's not a bad thing. The only real complaint I have is player numbers, but that's not something the developers can fix directly. It's definentely worth it even at full price and you wont get tired since you play sitting down.

Initially bought figuring I'd end up refunding as i've tried a couple other mech games. Will be hanging onto it though. Love that it takes a more sim approach. Slower combat. Controls are managed using the touch controllers rather than joysticks. Much more immersive and hands down the best game of its kind. Give it a shot and lets get these MP numbers up.

One of the best mech games to date.  They got just about everything right.  The controls are fluid and takes actuall skill to pilot the mechs.  The feel of piloting a giant machine is real.  The different game modes are awesome.  Online multiplayer works well.  This is an early access game at the time of this review so this is just the beginning.
Update: Still the best game ever but here are some things that are missing that should be added.
Player names should show up above enemy players so you know who is whooping you.
More Weapons Please
Worldwide scoring system
review_feedback: The Xbox controller now has its very own eject hotkey. Press the Menu + View button at the same time to eject much more conveniently than was possible before. On Xbox 360 controller these buttons are labelled Back + Start.

one_reviews_text: I have been playing this for weeks and it's still fun as hell.  When I was playing MechWarrior 2 on my 486dx2/50, I never in my wildest dreams thought that there would be EXACTLY THAT in VR 30 years later.  We have big, lumbering, heavy mechs. Heat management is important. Limbs can be blown off. It's all very similar to MW2.   The controls are all in VR and are really fun to use (provided your real life chair has arm rests).  Initially, I didn't like the virtual controls but they really have grown on me.  Also, there are bot only & local LAN only matches!  It's nice to have LAN as an option, even if I may never use it.

This game is awesome.  I can't wait to play when I get home from work.  Looking forward to updates with new grinders and planets.
Let's get some online players, everyone who tries it thinks that VM rocks!
Update:  game video occasionally freezes but sound continues and I have to quit and restart game (always in the middle of a close match).  Sound cuts out more frequently also requiring a restart (after quit must play with sound settings).  I don't know whether this is happening to others or just me.
In spite of this, it's still my favourite game.

This game is absolutely amazing! And worth every cent. If you want to know what it feels like to sit down in a lumbering tank and walk into battle against friends and random strangers, or launch into the sky with your jump jets and land in the middle of the fray, then buy this game! 

The touch controls are spot on. I can't think of anything that would make this more immersive without going out and building a full blown mech yourself!

My only complaint, if I have to give it one, is the lack of a single player campaign or multi-player co-op campaign. It's all battle mode... there is no back story or storyline.

However,  this is still one of the best games available!

nice game but all you'll ever play are the tutorials... nobody plays it...
save your $30... I'm going to purchase War Robots, they at least have a solo game as well as multi-player...

If this was any way being a kid again with mechwarrior 2 and remembering seeing the simulators with all the monitors and the little chair well this game blows all that away.  this game is in early access but so far it plays great smooth, and overall its fun. for 22$ roughly this game was well worth the price. 

out of all the mech games for vr THIS is a mech game, also plays perfectly nice in my chair, id highly reccomend a chair with arm rests if you do this is perfect. 

Also when you reset your view in app id suggest not to lean back. I leaned back in my chair and went to play a few games and accidentaly bopped my self in the nads trying to pull the ejection button. so uh ya keep straight posture for the reset view part or if you reset your view then you can lean back in the matches. learn from my mistake.
I've lost 5 days since buying this game. Just amazing.

review_title: Extremely fun, but needs more content.
one_reviews_text: Maybe a few more guns, or a campaign or coop mode, there's so much you guys can add to make this game one of the best out there.

Love the slow mech fights, very well done - would like to have hundred mechs with thousend parts in this game like the mech mmo, please patch patch patch and create a vr mwo with your own mechanics - worth the price for any mech fan - play with mouse and throttle, much easier than vr cockpit, but vr cockpit is very well done too -

I was surpirsed at how well thought-out the mech mechanics felt and you'll have a fun time for a while, but the game really lacks personality. Environments are bland, character voices are blander, mech design feels generic... It's a good mech sim without any personality

Bought this game during the Holiday sales and I'm so glad I did! The game makes you feel like you're piloting a giant mech. Graphics are solid. Performance is good and generally bug-free for an EA title. And I really enjoyed the gameplay and how you use the Touch controls to pull levers, turn knobs and basically pilot your mech. The only downside to the game (as others have stated) is that the servers can be low but that problem will be solved once you stop reading this review and buy the game! In all seriousness, it's a great game and very much worth the money. If the Dev(s) is/are reading this... would love to get some singleplayer content! Also, the ability to customize our mechs/pilots would be awesome! Keep up the good work and can't wait to see what else is in store for VM.

The sense of presense and scale and movement in this game are fantastic.
The cockpit the weight of the mechs is fab but I just don't want a multiplayer shooter.
I want a deep story and cool events and charagers and factions ;-(

The only thing stopping this game from getting 5* is the lack of single player or players in the MP universe, so I'm stuck fighting bots, this can be fun there is only so much. If only all Mech games have this level of control. Maybe some more torso movement controls like normal Mech games.

review_title: finally a mech gamet that's not on rails
one_reviews_text: controls are really nifty, this is the mech game i've been waiting for on VR. Finally, a game where you are in the cockpit of the mech, and it's not 'on rails'.   Nailed it!  Only thing I wish was that there was some kind of single player campaign like mechwarrior style with like missions and stuff. Maybe in a future update, but still really fun nonethe less and can practice with bots.

review_title: Only VR mech game im interested in
one_reviews_text: I have been waiting for a mech game that used the touch controllers completely and this game delivers in an excellent way. It only took me a couple of bot matches to be able to control the mechs rather easily using my touch controller. The graphics in this game are amazing. I love looking around my mech cockpit and seeing all the tiny details as well as the details of mechs blowing up. I do hope that the developers make different looks for each mechs cockpit and maybe customizable items inside and outside the mech. And although there are a good selection of mechs, I hope they will eventually add more as well as more weapons and maps and hopefully a campaign mode. That being said I do not regret spending the 25 dollars I spent to get this game. well worth it for what you get right now
It's crashing over and over again. None of my other games are having issues right now. It's very odd. I'm excited to play it...but can't yet.
review_feedback: Sorry to hear you are having trouble running the game! Please contact us at contact@space-bullet.com with your system specs and any details you can provide so we can assist you in fixing the problem.

one_reviews_text: I play this game day in and day out after already owning for 3 weeks. The experience is amazing. controls are perfect.  game is pvp so never the same experience. some things i would like to see is custom skins for mechs, more maps added, peoples name above the mech they are using, a ranking system of some sorts like so many kills you get this badge by your name and then after 5000 kills you have this badge etc would be really cool.  But bottom line is this is a early access game in development which is already by far the best game on vr so hopefully we will see some of these things come out. This is a must have have for everyone. The only game on vr you can play everday and never get bored. 5 diffent mech you can custom your weapons load out. matchs are 8v8, 5v5v5 and 4v4v4v4 no lack of action here. each mech has special traits, everyone online is really helpful if you have any questions.  The worst mistake you can make is by not purchasing this game.

Played over 2 hours in my first session itself - and that's a lot considering it's VR. The best thing about this game is that you can sit and play. That's how it enables you to have longer sessions.

Now to the game itself - it's a mech-sim multiplayer shooter with incredibly realistic physics. For example with rockets - you can't just aim and shoot - you have to anticipate the trajectory of the missile as well as the position your opponent will be at. It's very tactical. There are around 6 different mechs to choose from with an endless variety of weapon loadout combinations. It's best to try out a bunch of different mechs / weapons and see what suits your playstyle best. 

One thing that happens often with multiplayer VR games is low server populations which leads to declining playerbase. I'm glad to say that's not the case with this game. Lots of people to play with (since it has cross platform enabled between Rift and Vive users - and this game has gained a lot of traction) as well as the game fills empty spaces with bots if needed.

Overall, a really solid VR game if you're a fan of mechs, tactical gameplay and realistic physics.

Update: Now after having played countless hours on this game - the only reason I'm giving 4 stars not 5 is because of the occasional crash and a few minor bugs. But since it's Early Access it can be forgiven - but still 4 stars for now. If at final launch all of these are sorted it's 5 stars for sure!

Really solid gameplay.  Mech Warrior 4  with a dash of rock em sock em robots and Transformers.  Graphics aren't bad, I've seen better looking VR mech games . This one takes the cake  due to the gameplay and content.  Nice to be able to get use to the combat in an offline mode. Was delighted to find there was close to instant combat in the multiplayer arena. Much lower latency than I ever had on any EA/Origin or Steam.  Titanfall looked stunning with old school 3D VR gear but fell short in  many ways . Mech warrior 4 was brilliant in old school VR.  You had to attack land outposts.  Until this game, it was the best VR mech game of all time in my book, but I think Ithis one has taken the title.  Make sequel, I will buy :)

These are the droids you are looking for.

Edit: Ok after a few hours of player V bots I just spent 5 hours of PVP. 8 players. Most game modes, teams, death match etc. The voice coms is off the hook, so well done. This is an alpha version 0.2?? Also running maxed everything on a 980ti, i7-4770 and 16g butter smooth.  Outstanding!

Good mech game with real sense of immersion.  Nice community could do with more playing it but am sure that come in time.  If you love mech games and looking for one that ticks all boxes. Look no further than here

Once this gets more fleshed out, I don't know if I could get back to into MWO in the same way I once did. I've been waiting for a VR mech game with this pace and immersion, It's very close to the feel I was hoping for. It has a feel somewhere between MWO, Hawken, and Gurren Lagann, mixed with trucker-like themes. This is the first VR game that I have felt impatient during the day to get back to.  There is still a lot of room for metagame stuff and some feeling of progression to give reason to the battles, amongst other things, but this is alpha, and a great alpha at that.

A few days into the game's release and it just now really set in that this is an alpha product. I would be happy if the developers left the game as is, but what excites me is where this can go.
This game is really fun, but  sometimes my hands will lag and not move, causing me to explode. This might be because I have two sensors, but idk.

I will be biased, because I fell in love with this game. 
It's slower paced, and a bit more tactical, and I like that.
Strong steampunk themes and an awesome atmosphere, some features like radio and horn makes you feel like a trucker.

Why I give it 5 stars is because of how polished so far is, and only made by 3 devs. Really impressed how well it runs on just a 1070. I have most settings on high, and 1.4 supersampling, not a hitch, locked at 90 fps, even when there is a lot going on.
The game looks crisp!

One of the best games I have ever played!!! Epic battles, immersive, awesome mechs to pilot. This game should be advertised alongside Robo Recall and other classics to illustrate the power of VR gaming :) I hope Oculus invest some major money into this game..

After reading all the 5 star reviews I have to admit to being a little dissapointed. The game is okay, I would even go as far to say it's good, but for me it has a number of issues that perhaps could be addressed.
The game itself is well made and I like the concept of walking around in a large mech Warrior. The cockpit layout is adequate and the controls work okay but can be a little clunky. Using thrusters is very confusing in terms of control. All these things can be lived with. Where the game lets itself down is playability.
There seems to be only one game mode and that's online stomp around destroy the enemy. There's not strategy, no side campaigns, no offline mode, no other things to do. Just join game, destroy the other team. It's a bit limiting and I suspect will get tedious very quickly. Walking around doesn't give me that sense of controlling a large heavy beast. Scale is a little off and the sounds are not immersive enougth, where's the eject animation and what's the deal with shutting down when you overheat. That's a real buzz kill. Sure shut the weapons down but I still want to move and feel like I'm in game.
I think with more things to do in game, different missions, different campaigns. A better set of sounds (where's all that hydraulic and piston action), improved graphics and a feeling of lugging a heavy beast around it would be a better game.
review_feedback: Hi there DogTailRed2, there are some quick things I'd like to clarify regarding your feedback. There are currently 3 gameplay modes: Classic DM/TDM, Salvage, and Stockpile, each providing unique objectives. We do have an offline play in the form of starting your own matches (online/offline/LAN) with bots, and you can customize maps/modes/team#s/Playercount. Since we released as an Early Access title, we will be adding new modes and features in the coming months, so we encourage you to check it out again in the future to see if your impressions improve.

one_reviews_text: One of, if not the, best VR experiences out there!

This is closer to what I've been looking for in a mech simulator. Being able to reach around and control things makes it a lot more immersive. Making it also a seated experience is a nice break from the room scale things that have sort of taken over.

It feels less arcade like and more simulation which I appreciate. I'd actually be even happier if they went further in that direction, with customization options for mechs and arranging loadouts and the like. Still, for what it is I think it's the best VR mech game I've played.
This is a fun game.  Well done. Good feeling of actually being inside and controlling the Mech.  Good PVP implementation. Definitiely worth the price.  A keeper.  Get it!!!

While I have been disapointed by many of the paid games for VR so far, this is by far one of the best games VR or non VR I have played. Awesome mec simulation. It would be nice if there was a story line like Mech Warrior had, however, it is early access so who knows what may come in the future

installed just before xmas and was quite impressed with graphics and gameplay.
I was never really a mechwarrior game fan so this is suprising.
Only suggestion is to advise everyone that you MUST install to an ssd drive because mechanical drives just will not do the job.
I have an high performance pc and struggled on normal hard drive install.
Once moved to ssd it solved all my stuttering issues and made gameplay 100% better .

Perfect controls, you control your mech with the actual robot control rather than just the controller. This game deserve all the praises. 

Hopefully this will become big.

After trying Hawken back in the day and Archangel Hellfire more recently, I can say that Vox Machinae gets the giant robot combat right.  You have a nice variety of grinders with a variety of weapons catering to different playstyles.  The maps are varied and the objective-based game modes make things interesting.  The physics do feel floaty and the inverse kinematics could use some tweaks, but it's a great experience.  So grab that CB and jump in to the action (just don't jump too high or you'll break your legs on landing...)

I love the air horns...
I'd dare say the best online experience i've had in VR by far..
The game runs great.. pretty easy to get the hang of and the  different classes seem pretty well balanced and unique..
I'm playing down in AUS, lag doesn't seem to be an issue when playing with people from the USA or EU.. 
Comms are actually quite fun.. would be good if people were a little less shy.. the talkative teams have a tactical advantage..

Oculus has issues with this game but they're resolved by not maxing out the graphics, despite your maxed out GTX 1080. Still...

I've spent more time playing this incredibly immersive "FPS" mech game than I have any other game on Oculus. I used to spend that time playing Overwatch. Where do I even begin? The controls, levers, knobs and other displays and monitors are really neat. I forget sometimes that I'm at home and not inside a giant robot.

I love the pace of the gameplay and how each game type tends to require a different loadout and strategy to win.  Mechs have their strengths and weaknesses and it's important to discover what they are.

I'm rescinding my previous gripe heavy review.  I essentially described buying what felt like an early access game but it wasn't labeled as such in the Oculus store.  The Dev(s?) replied to that review to let me know about that store bug.

I can't keep a mediocre review up where I basically say "This early access game feels like an early access game!" nor do I see an option to delete my review.  I'm tentatively bumping my 3/5 to 4/5 but we're stopping short of a perfect 5/7

This is an awesome title. Loved the immersion of being in the cockpit and operating the mech with my hands rather than a joystick. The weapons, explotions, control levers and particularly the heavy stepping of the mech was very satisfying. The only down side of it was the lack of content. After completing the tutorial there is nothing else to do, just jumping into mindless shoot-em-up multiplayer matches. For a lone wolf like myself that does not like multiplayer games, it was a dead end. This is why I requested a refund. I will totally buy this game again, though, after the devs add some kind of story or something for a single player mode (fingers crossed!). Awesome experience, though. Loved piloting the mechs! Kudos!

three star are for the VR side ... VR side dose need more work on the res/graphics and seem to move slower when walking about than it does in desktop mode ... as a desktop game works well ... thanks for hard work and hope you are able to do more for the VR side of things and dose feel over brightly + a bit blurry in VR .. but it is early days for the game :)
review_feedback: The game might get blurry due to the dynamic resolution option. If you increased the settings higher than default, then the game could compensate by lowering resolution to maintain high frame rate. You have the option of disabling dynamic resolution, at the trade off of some missed frames. Completely up to your preference. :)

one_reviews_text: First review I have written but this deserves it. VR was built for a game like this and these guys have done a good job. Runs super smooth with my gtx 1070 and I7-7700k. The graphics are not cutting edge but the details such as smoke, dust, parts flying off and seeing people eject just looks awesome-the sense of actually being in a big Mech is just so right. It also runs super smooth with my GTX1070 and I7-7700K.  The potential with this game to build Mechs, weapon loadouts, etc is tremendous so i really hope the developers can run with this thing! In any case for an early access this is a pretty great game and easily one of the best VR buys in my opinion.

Everything about this game is perfect.  The grunginess of the mechs, the shaking of the earth with each step, the loud thunderous blasts as you sink a full clip of flak cannon shots into an enemy mech and watch huge metal sheets of his armor (and maybe an arm and leg shear off).

The controls and immersion of this game really makes you feel like you are in a giant mech.  Everything is well though out, from the CB radio for coms, to the design and role of the mechs.

This is a must have game for anyone with VR.  Everyone with a VR headset should own this game.  It's a must have!  While its early access, it plays like a polished game.  I can't wait to see what else they add.

11/10

Having played the mech warrior games in the (90's?) this VR version is really enjoyable, and definitely gives the feel of piloting simple, very large, machines.   Some cool damage effects too.   The environments are a bit too primordial for my tastes, but it's just an arena I suppose.
On default settings it's 3 out 10 on the nausea scale (>=5 is too much for me), so I'll be trying out the comfort options unfortunately.

I was defiantly taken back by how pretty it was when it was first loaded up, then I realised it had super sampling(so that was deffo cranked up more). The controls feel quite smooth and natural-ish...(kinda like driving a JCB but with weapons and a jetpack.) I can see why it has been given a near 5 star review so far.

[Note for the dev(s)]
I suggest changing the Fuel concept to Power Reserves (or something along those lines) as that makes more sense to regenerate :)

I dont leave many reviews but frankly not many VR games are impressive enought to even take the time. i must say though they have done a wonderfull job thus far. It is well worth the money and and i feel it has lots of room to grow. I say give the game a shot, it plays really well and is a blast with or without friends!
PS: If you ever played any of the old mech games dont even think about it, just buy the game you will love it!

The game itself is very good, I love how we get to pilot a big machine in a simillar fashion how you would pilot a Ship in 'Start Trek: Crew'. Gameplay is slow as you have to micromanage every movement and it makes the pilot think about their actions rather than act on the whim. I found the tutorial nice as it was fast and gave you the overall idea on how to operate the mecha. I LOVE how communications works in the game. To talk you have to take hand off the joystick and grab a walkie-talkie, there is no time for ussless chatter. 

Now, I'd love to see some customisations added to the game, where we could edit our cockpit and perhaps change the 'AI' voice, maybe even edit the look of the robot. It would also be nice to have 5v5 modes. When using a minigun I feel like I'm shooting peas. The visuals of the bullets are not very good.

Only 3 stars for now but it's the best VR Mech game out there at the moment.
What it lacks is weapons, mechs and maps. The choice is to limited for me and I don't know whether to refund and see how the game progresses.

I was an avid Mechwarrior 3/4  player back in the day, sinking countless hours online playing competitively but what that game had was the ability to heavily customise mechs with a vast aray of weapons and units, which for me was what kept me playing for years. 

This game, while good doesn't have the options that would make me want to play the again and again, which will be it's demise unless expansions are on the horizon.

Big thanks to the Devs for what you've done so far and I hope there's more to come!

This is a great game, well worth the asking price.  If you want to feel the experience of operating a large mech, this is the game for you.  I've been waiting 3-4 years for this experience in VR and it was worth the wait.  However, after playing the game 3 or 4 times, the initial wow factor is fading, but I would still recommend purchasing it, since its a beta and more content will eventually follow.

I owned the original DK1 version of this game and loved that, this polished full version is such a joy to play. The way you interact with the controls is so fun and intuitive, it's a pleasure blowing other mechs to pieces while frantically fumbling with the controls around you and blowing your truckers horn after a big victory. 
The walkie talkie voice communication system is also a lot of fun to use and enourages me to talk more than I would in most other games.

I wish there were even more little things to interact with in the mech cockpit, maybe headlights, windshield wipers, bobbleheads, switches, radio, etc. Just little things to make the environment feel completely interactive. I noticed that there are some bars you can hold at the top on the cockpit but they don't seem to do anything.

I also think further avatar customization could be a nice addition, beards, hair styles, hats, glasses, etc. A good progression system of cosmetic mech skins and pilot outfits could probably help this game stay active for a long time.

review_title: So Nice, I bought it TWICE!!!
one_reviews_text:
Once on Steam and the other here, for reasons of friends list and to support the devs. 

I don't think it's unfair to say that this game captures the little boy dream inside of me in letting me be the pilot of a giant mechanized walking tank. After years of having to make due with fighting giant robots on a screen Vox Machinae comes along and puts me in the cockpit, and then makes me move the throttle, turn the torse, fire the weapons, fire the boosters, and pull the eject handle! 

This game is a blast. If you ever once watched ginat robots as a youngin and wanted to be strapped on the inside of one to do battle with other giant robots, well then it doesn't get better than this. 

The community has been great, good manners and tons of helpful players that are more than willing to lend a hand and a word on how to run your mech better even when they are on the other team. A+++ The devs should be very very proud of this game.

The combat is solid and immersive, along with the piloting. Everything from ejecting to moving is immersive and fun. Easily worth the 30 dollars it asks for, and multiplayer seems to have plenty of players, and solid gameplay. I still havent won a single game but had a blast anyways. So far though it doesnt seem to have any game mode other than multiplayer, and doesnt (as far as I can tell) have any system to allow you to improve upon the mech's you pilot, wether it be weapons, armor, ect. Either way, solid game 8/10 always room for improvement.

review_title: 3 Stars as is but could be a 5 later
one_reviews_text:
This is an Early acces title but being as I paid for it now my score will reflect what it is now, and while 3 out of 5 to some may seam harsh I can ashure you I am overall enjoying this game.
 + Absolutely beautifull mech game, best in class.
+actual interactive Cockpit controls right down to grabbing your trucker style CB radio for coms.
+Swappable weapon loadouts.
on the down side or TBA
-only a handfull of mechs and maps.
-tutorial is very bare bones.
-lacks any singleplayer campaign 

should you buy it? well if your a Mechwarrior Fan like me heck yeah! this comes very close to capturing that feeling, but if you realy want a singleplayer Campaign and like the more anime style mechs Archangel Hellfire is probably your best bet.

Bought this game tonight and was really looking forward to playing.  I keep trying to join a game and it comes up "disconnected, server not responding".  I have played other games tonight and no problem.  Thoughts?
ok believe me my friend,YOU WILL LIKE THIS GAME. NOT A WASTE OF MONEY

review_title: This is what the other guys should be!
one_reviews_text:
Trully excellent BFR (Big Fighting Robots ahem... MW) game simulator.  Looks and plays amazingly well. The devs did a great job of simulating moving in a big lumbering war machine. The game music helps with setting the atmosphere and your mech's AI is helpful and unobtrusive. Hats off for the team chat cam where you see what the other player avatars look like.  Nothing major to complain about. 
As I ong time fan of MW this is a really fun game and hope the devs make lots of $$$ to continue developing it.

After having tried another famous mech game and immediately uninstalled it, I had a go at this and it's really something. Extremely immersive and really interesting interface system, in fact so good if HOTAS were to be introduced, it would be a bonus but the game is also really fun with the current control system with the touch controller. 

The game begs for a single player campaign or some sort of narrative direction, it needs a bit more structure, however having said that, in spite of the lack of the latter, it is definitely worth its money, in fact it's one of the most compelling titles to date on Rift, as far as I am concerned (and I'm not a huge fan of mechs usually). Well done!

It would be a 4 star because there is room for improvement, but the game struck me as so bloody cool that I HAVE to give it full marks. If they add customizable mech content and a campaign or better objectives, I wouldn't know how to find all the stars it would deserve. 

This is a three-man team, and that considered they've done an amazing job. If I were at the top of the Oculus direction, I'd be donating extra staff to work on this, it could be huge.

Seriously, if you've ever loved the mech genre, this is a MUST.  

To the devs:  I would love it if you don't ever make weapons unlockable, or for sale.  That way everyone has the exact same opportunity as everyone else- no vets destroying noobs with a crazy advantage.  BUT, to keep it interesting- allocate each frame a, say, "battery limit," or "equipment slots," beyond just weapons, and let each player choose some extra stuff- like chaff, or boosted sensors, extra jump fuel tanks, etc.

Thanks for an awesome game!!!!!!!
Great game with nice graphics aswell as gameplay and unlike other Multiplayer VR games you can actually find a match on this one.
This is the mech sim I have been waiting for since buying my oculus. Developers, please take note this is how you do this kind of game beautifully.

Easily 5 stars considering the experience and the cost.  Gets so many things right about what a "mech" game should be.  This level of "driving" a mech, immersed in VR, the experience is absolutely stunning.  Definately my favorite VR game of over 50 installed titles.

Caveats:
No single player campaign, and hardly any players online, but the offline death match with bots is more than worth the price.  

Hoping for more mechs, weapons, skins, maps and mechanics (such as heat sinks and deeper loadout options)... in other words, the game is awesome and I hope to see it invested in and fleshed-out.

Wish there was a mod community.

Bought my copy through Oculus store, but I think the Steam version ALSO comes with a non-VR version, which I do not seem to have.  Sort of a bummer for the times when the VR gets you motion-sick and you still want to play.

review_title: Like having a Battle Tech Center at home
one_reviews_text:
This is a system seller. If you've been looking for something to show off why you were interested in VR, now you have it. 

More than that, it's a very good game. In 1990 (yes, way back then) I was lucky enough to be invited to play in a tournament at Chicago's Battle Tech Center -- a dedicated facility simulating mech combat using an insane amount of hardware. This is, finally, the true heir to that game. And you can play it at home.

I fell in love with this game, the commands inside the mech are super fun and intuitive. I got a stupid smile on my face during all the gameplay because of how much is fun to just move around with your mech. I played alot of Hawken in the past and this is a solid mech game. The multiplayer is very engaging. I highly recommend to buy this game.

Ok so i have been following the game for a bit and apon its launch i waited for a day or so looking over the reviews. I feel now that i should of gone on faith and got it on launch day due to time lost playing this well polished great game.
Grabbing pannels into view, looing around the cockpit(there is a bed behind you like a truck cab) and shooting off bits off other people. 
Little extras in the game bring it more into play with the feel of being in a mech or killer gun truck on legs! 1. The horn u pull to blow! noice! 2. Grabbing the walkie talkie to chat to your team. noice  3. The screen to your left that shows in in game char to your team mates while u have it in hand in vid form! noice noice nice! 
All in all a great game that came out of nowhere! 
three thumbs up!
I hope the dev team make a bucket load of money as they deserve it!

review_title: The wait was well worth it.
one_reviews_text:
I've been waiting quite a while for this game to be released, it was well worth it.
It still needs some polish, but for a VR mech sim I'd say it has the potential to be a top shelf pick for anyone who wants a multiplayer shooter that is VR.  Touch controls are very easy to get a grasp on and don't give you the awkward feeling you get trying to grasp something in VR.

I played this back during dk2, and ive got to say, this went from a corky fun mech game demo to something really amazing. The controls are beyond tight, they are exactly what I wanted. If you ever wanted to pilot big O or a gundam and do all the crazy fun hand movements to get your mech going, this is the game to grab! I will say that I realy really wish there was a story mode, but once you get into a match online, you just have a great time!

I would honestly buy a rift just to play this game.. Incredible job.. the touch controls work brilliantly in the cabin. the Video intercom is genius (and hilarious) the graphics are amazing, and the sense of scale is stunning.. This has been worth every penny! Im hoping the PSVR release will be cross platform as its a ton of fun playing with other team members. MUST BUY!

review_title: Low end VR computer runs this fine
one_reviews_text: My computer isnt the best but the graphics are suprisingly solid. This game is HARD. You really have to get tactical with your decisions, your weapons, and your team. I lost my mind when I could see other players avatars on screen talking to me in combat - that was really cool. The difference betwee this and the other mech games is that they're really fast paced. Rush in and hope for the best. This one is more realistic - slow and tactical. The others also seem really gundam-ish whereas if we built giant robots in real life these seem more practical. I wish I didn't have to go to work so I could lose myself in battle. This game needs a story mode though...like old school mechwarrior mercinaries or something. I also LOVE how you can customize and build your own mech loadouts. That was the fifth star for me!

review_title: Amazing game, Hope Quest gets it too
one_reviews_text:
I played the beta on the DK2 years ago, so I had to return to this game. Allthough I got used to Archangel Hellfire a while ago and I initially thought the gameplay would be "kinda the same"

Boy was I wrong. 
Don't get me wrong, Archangel Hellfire is awesome as a Mech game, but it's more arcadey and fast paced, this game however feels way more realistic as u don't use the thumbsticks, but a lever for every move with the Touch controls.  Very Sim like. U could say that Archangel is the Pavlov version & Vox Machinae is the Onward version of mechs.

review_title: So Nice I wanna buy it twice!
one_reviews_text: Guys even in early access this game really delivers the fun.  I generally don't play much online multiplayer but this game has me calling out stupid military sounding squad commands on the CB radio and pulling the air horn before I drop out of the sky right into the face of a heavy mech with dual cannons and a volley of missiles!   Old school Mechwarrior fans this is the one we have been waiting on.

I have played many mech games over the years, and none of them hit the mark. Until now that is. So far I have had no bugs and the game mechanics and controls feel natural after only 2 minutes of gameplay. Seriously, I thought this would have a major learning curve. I was wrong. After two minutes, I didn't have to look down or around for any controls. I was just there. VM is a VR must. Thank you devs, I look forward to more content!

This game is awesome. Gives you the feeling as if you are truly controlling this massive machine. It has very fun, immersive, and intense gameplay. You get to be seated which is nice, and adds to the effect of you piloting these beasts. Needs a larger community for online play, but it will get there no doubt. Looking forward to all the updates this game comes out with. MUST HAVE!!

THIS is the Mech game you're looking for. Mechwarrior, Battletech - who needs a licensed I.P. when you have a dedicated bunch of guys that want to make the best VR mech assault game ever and they deliver. Shocking to think this is only Alpha state and it's only going to get better from here. Sounds like a 6/5 to me.

I played this game about a day ago and I loved it. The game has very good visuals and there were little to no glitches while in game. The game could be better if there is more customization options. like changing the layout of the cockpit (like the look lever was in the middle and the accelleratin/deceleration stick was like a fighter plane), or  maybe add decals. This would make players feel like thewy have their own unique robot, but for now just add a way to put markers on the radar.

If you have any interest in Mech combat ,do yourself a favor and pick up this game.  This is what VR gaming should be. Dev's keep picking away at small problems but honestly this game performs well.  Learning curve is not steep , I picked it up in couple matches.

review_title: A winner (but please devs look here)
one_reviews_text: So here I am playing perhaps the greatest game made by mankind. A true evolutionary milestone. But then suddenly the screen goes completely black. Oh no! I still have sound but everything is pitch black. Now I do admit taking a potion beforehand. A certain OpenTPCast. Hey! Don't you blame me. I want the lots! All of VR. Complete freedom. I hope it one day includes this marvelous game. Until then I will investigate why the screen turns black and if it is OpenTPCast or the game itself.

The game is really good And excited have a quality graphic ,Movement And the way you control the mech Is great Is different it make you feel like you're really in the mech.With this controllers in all the way they did it again is super great if they made a Co op campaign .Looking forward for something like that. I really recommend to buy this game.

I was honestly expecting to play 15 minutes of this, be disappointed, and get a refund since I had not heard anything about it until a few days ago when it was released. Instead I found a surprisingly polished, fun, well designed, unique experience. Well worth the price if you are on the fence.

Vox Machinae gets so much right as a weighty, simulation-esque mech combat game. Battles tend to be relatively slow-paced, especially with heavier mechs, and a "go-it-alone" attitude is often severely punished thanks to 16-player servers in which wandering into an enemy team invariably leads to a swift, merciless death. Aiming feels solid and isn't ever twitchy, even with Oculus Touch controls. At the time of writing, several of the game's many servers were full, leading to some intense 8 versus 8 battles.

Vox Machinae sports multiple objectives across a variety of maps, and the loadouts of the game's healthy variety of mechs can all be customized, leading to a great deal of replay value. The game rewards tactical, team-based gameplay and team communication, especially during domination or salvage missions, and failing to coordinate and communicate properly can lead to lopsided losses against competent enemy teams.

Visually, the game looks great, especially when it comes to lighting on certain maps. The game runs buttery smooth, even on my GTX 1060 6gb. The audio is similarly fantastic, with a gripping, distinctly Terminator-esque soundtrack that's chock full of synth.

Special praise should be given to the game's unique communication system. Whenever you pick up your radio to speak to your team, your avatar is displayed on a monitor in each teammate's cockpick, and there's even lip sync. In addition, whenever you destroy an enemy mech, your AI assistant will actually call out the name of the enemy you killed (although it isn't perfect). All of this adds a hefty layer of immersion to an already immersive VR experience.

This is, without dispute, the definitive mech combat title for VR and one of the best multiplayer VR experiences currently available. Even if you're iffy about mech combat games, give this a shot!
every nerd's dream.... control a giant mech and shoot stuff! not many vr experiences are so much fun and kept me hooked for a longer time

This game is not comfortable! I wanted to puke pretty fast after playing this one. I'm really dissapointed. Seemed like it would be promising. I think it's because the cockpit window is too big, if it was smaller I might be ok like in elite dangerous.
I played it for five minutes and won't be trying it again until there is an update or something.

I played your demo back when DK1/2 was around. And all i did was wait for the time you were going to release this game.. 
such a long wait, sometimes we didnt even hear from you for months.. and now here it is..

better than before even :-) thanks for that awesome MECH game !!!

This is a very well polished mech fighting game.  I am not fond of using the Oculus touch for controls, however it is an intresting way to implement it.  Hook up a gamepad and I find the controls work very well.

These developers are on to something. While I wish MWO were a VR game this is an excellent stab at making something in its place. There are many areas that I'd like to see improved and expanded on but it's great fun while I wait for more! Worth a try! Quick learning curve and a good amount of fun. I want a meta game though, something to strive for please?

I was excited for this one, and it has the potential to be great, but it was desperately lacking in content when I played.  Not even ready for early access, although the gameplay itself was polished enough, there was so little actual content.  Was hoping for something like Mechwarrior Online but in VR.  Might check back in a year to see if its finished.
very fun. Anyone who enjoys operating heavy equipment would probably like this. Anyone who enjoys operating heavy equipment with rocket launchers strapped to the sides will really like this one.

review_title: Fun, Long Combat with No Quick Deaths
one_reviews_text: This game has a lot of potential. I quite enjoyed my first day playing. I hope enough people buy it so there is a decent-sized player base. It is worth the $25 I paid for it.
Worth it

You are in total control of that giant metal beast! 
handsdown a must buy!  GG developers,  keep the game updated and add more content and you will have a  solid egames Contender here!
Stop reading reviews and buy it! its Epic.

Best Mech game so far. i would love to see more custom options other than weapons like more heat restitance or something.
MP is fun and i really enjoy the banter between rounds

This game is so well made and polished I was breathtaken when I began playing.
You actually feel like you are controlling a robot and the social aspect is amazing.
Get this game and support quality games
I would recommend this to anyone who likes to blow stuff up while in a giant mech suit this is the game. I wish I would have known about this game sooner.

Been waiting for a decent mech game since mechwarrior online didn't plan out.
Hope they'll keep the sim approach and expand on loadouts and gamemodes etc.
Feels like you're in a giant lumbering mech.  Good player base - there were multiple games of 8v8.  The game makes great use of touch controls!  Definitely worth the price!
Bought it with no expectations! Was in for a treat! Buy it!
This is what you've always imagined piloting a mech would be like ! please patch parts and mechs !!!!!!!

The feeling of controlling this old Mechs is unbelievable.
Back to the times before the clan invasion.
Greetings from House Steiner!
A solid VR game, and a solid desktop game. Fun both ways. You can manually launch the game .exe from the install directory if you want to play in Desktop mode.
I absolutely LOVE this game. One of the most immersive experiences ever - a must-buy!
love it so far. only played for 20 min but love it.
Title and picture look cheesy but the reviews are right, this is an awesome game. This is how a mech game should be made in VR!
This is the two-story, heavy, ponderous, walking tank simulator arena combat game you've been looking for.
Highly immersive VR mech game that plays like a dream and it's an alpha.  I can see this getting a lot better.
Strangely satisfying but could do with some bulking out of the game modes.
This is the mech-warrior game you've dreamt about. It's fantastic, immersive, feels great.
Quickly becoming one of my favourite VR games. Well worth the money!
Fantastic game in VR is amazing,recommended!!
if you spent mony on vr then spend 25 and buy this
Great mech game with VR the way it should be.
I haven't had this much fun in VR in a long time!
Lots of things missing, needs to improve

Best Mech game I've played in VR and one of the best VR games I've played yet. Being able to play sitting down with a controller is great and it looks and controls great as well. Feels like the real deal.

review_title: The VR Mech game you alway wanted
one_reviews_text: Played the very early demo and was amazed piloting a mech in VR. I was very excited to participate in the beta and I’m glad it turned out to be such a solid product. Worth a try if you have ever wanted to pilot a massive war machine in VR. The sense of scale and the immersion is especially great, very polished.

review_title: awesome game with really unique gameplay
one_reviews_text: awesome game with really unique gameplay
